items.title: Warren Buffett’s blind spot: Did the digital economy leave him behind?
items.description: Warren Buffett posted pedestrian investment returns over the last years of his career, due largely to a failure to grasp the potential of Big Tech.

items.title: A vicious cycle beats a virtuous one: How Warren Buffett’s Geico fell behind Progressive in the auto insurance race
items.description: While Geico was investing in marketing and neglecting IT, its rival Progressive was investing in technology and gaining market share.

items.title: Simon Sinek says not to worry about salaries during a job interview. Instead, ‘choose the job based on who you’re going to work for’
items.description: “Yes, I made less money than all of my friends in the short term,” Sinek said. But “I got an education and care from somebody who took me under their ...

items.title: AI adoption at scale is hard. Just look at India, which processes about 20 billion transactions every month
items.description: The most valuable AI systems will not look dramatic. They will look ordinary. They will fade into routine decisions and familiar processes.

items.title: Why Singapore is the only Southeast Asian country in Pax Silica, the U.S.’s new AI ‘inner circle’
items.description: Singapore is “precisely the kind of ‘trusted node’ the U.S. is seeking to anchor AI-era supply chains,” says Ruben Durante, a professor at Singapore's...
